definition: gap/unoccupied space or time/fig. gap/loophole
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)

sentences.english: Some of them beat the economic policy.
sentences.chinese: 他們有些人鑽了經濟政策的空子。

sentences.english: Laws are made to be broken.
sentences.chinese: 法律就是用來鑽空子的。

sentences.english: And meanwhile, the militants are taking full advantage.
sentences.chinese: 而與此同時，激進分子正在鑽空子。

sentences.english: We mainly discuss topological limit of trajectories of non-empty subsets of X.
sentences.chinese: 主要研究X的非空子集的軌跡的拓撲極限。

sentences.english: You can sometimes get round the tax laws.
sentences.chinese: 有時，人們能夠鑽稅收法律的空子。

sentences.english: The paper marriages provide a twisted legal channel for immigration.
sentences.chinese: 用結婚證書移民不過是鑽了個空子，但它至少合法。

sentences.english: Second, the new capital regime must be harder to game.
sentences.chinese: 第二，新的資本準則必須讓銀行很難鑽空子。

sentences.english: Now, the laws have improved, but there are still a lot of people looking for loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 可是現在，法律進步了，但還是有那麼多鑽空子的人。

definition: lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to have an opportunity that one can exploit (idiom)
leak/hole/gap/loophole
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
illegal device/devious/crooked
(coll.) unexpectedly
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
food/salary (old)/a pretext/a cause for gossip
to trap/to frame
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3
